title-group.article-title: Performance of a Ceramic Diesel Particulate Trap Over Typical Mining Duty Cycles Using Fuel Additives

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1986 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The performance of a ceramic wallflow diesel particulate trap is described in relation to regeneration behaviour and emissions reduction from a typical mines heavy duty diesel engine.The use of fuel additives lowered particulate ignition temperature thresholds by approximately 150oc, and allowed frequent regeneration of the trap to occur when the engine was operated on a computer controlled engine dynamometer over simulated mine vehicle duty cycles. Thermal stress on the trap during regeneration was minimal. Use of the fuel additive had little effect on changing the trap efficiency for particulate emission reduction which remained generally in excess of 90% efficient. In addition, the fuel additives did not increase sulphate emissions, and reduced Ames mutagenic activity. This approach appears to offer a practical and effective means of diesel emissions control, for most mine LHD vehicles, without the need for additional trap regeneration systems, other than the use of fuel additives.

ref.mixed-citation: Effects of Catalytic Wire-Mesh Traps on the Level and Measurement of Heavy-Duty Diesel Particulate Emissions, V.W. Wong, M.L. Yu, Z.A.N. Mogaka and S.M. Shahed SAE (840172) .
Catalytic Particulate Control of Off-Highway Diesels, E.R. Budd and B.E. Enga SAE(840170) .
Evaluation of an Emissions Control Strategy for Underground Diesel Mining Equipment, A. Stawsky, A. Lawson, H. Vergeer, and F. A. Sharp SAE (840176).
Preliminary Particulate Trap Tests on a 2-Stroke Diesel Bus Engine, Gerry L. Ullman, Charles T. Hare, and Thomas M. Baines SAE(840079), February 1984.
Diesel Exhaust Particulate Control by Monolith Trap and Fuel Additive Regeneration, O.A. Ludecke and K.B. Bly (840077).
Regeneration Behaviour of Light Duty Catalytic Trap Oxidizer Systems, M.F. Buchanan and B.E. Enga, (840080).
Paper presented at CRC-APRAC-CAPI- 1-64, Chemical Characterization of Diesel Exhaust Emissions Workshop, March 1981.
